learning_outcomes.description: identify plants using different types of keys
find resources to help you to identify plants
know terminology relating to plant characters
collect, preserve and store plant specimens

assessments.task_description:
Three choices

 

Heathlands using data from field trip

Eucalypt-rainforest transition using data from field trip

Adopt a rare plant species
assessments.submission_guidelines:
The Assessment submission procedure is as follows:
Students are required to submit through Turnitin which can be found on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Plant collection and key to collection
assessments.task_description: Collection of a herbarium of 25 identified plants from a single habitat and an accompanying key to the collection.
assessments.submission_guidelines:
The Assessment submission procedure is as follows:
1. You will be sent the cover sheet for your assignment by e-mail approximately 2 weeks before it is due.
2. You must submit your assignment, with the coversheet attached to the front, through the assignment slot at the SIB Help Desk (Room 229, Goddard Building) by 4.00pm on the above date/dates.
3. You will then receive a receipt. Please retain this receipt as proof of submission. If assessment submission is disputed, you MUST produce this receipt.
4. Please ensure that you keep an electronic copy of every piece of assessment you submit.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description: Students will be presented with fresh plant specimens to test identification skills
assessments.submission_guidelines: The exam involves identifying and answering questions about live plant material
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Plant Collection

Students are to prepare a herbarium collection of 25 flowering plant specimens from a single habitat.

Students will be responsible for collecting and identifying their specimens outside of class hours
learning_activities.topic_description: Plant Collection Students are to prepare a herbarium collection of 25 flowering plant specimens from a single habitat. Students will be responsible for collecting and identifying their specimens outside of class hours
